Surrender.definition: to yield to the control or possession of another [ the leased premises] [ collateral to a creditor] b

1 a.definition: to yield to the control or possession of another [ the leased premises] [ collateral to a creditor]

sub_terms.b: to give up completely or agree to forgo

2.definition: to give over to the custody of the law [ a defendant]to give oneself upnan act or instance of surrendering [discharge an obligor by of a promissory note]the yielding of an estate by a tenant to the landlord so that the leasehold interest is extinguished by mutual agreement
